properties.name: Payload for WF having target and Account Keys
MangoDB_API_KEy
properties.description:
Enter the API Key for MangoDB for respsective ENV. 

Currenlty QA1 Value is stored in the Input

properties.name: MangoDB_APP_Name
properties.description:
Enter the APP Name for MangoDB for respsective ENV. 

Currenlty QA1 Value is stored in the Input

Note -- Select custom Target
1. Import workflow which Contains HTTP Action, Target , Account Keys , Global Variable and Environment Variable and Publish the workflow 
2. Install above Published Exchange in Same Tenant Where it Published 
3.  Install above Published Exchange in different tenant with Skip All Option 
4.  Install above Published Exchange in different tenant  with skip account Keys , Variable and Update the target details 
5. Install above Published Exchange in different tenant with skip target , Variable and Update Account Keys 
6. Install above Published Exchange in different tenant with skip target , account keys and Update Variable 
7. Install above Published Exchange in different tenant with Updating target , Account Keys and Variable 
8. Reinstall the Published exchange in one of the tenant 
9. Clean Up (Delete the workflow which i used to Publish , Delete the workflow instance, workflow, target, account keys and Variables in all tenants which got created on Installing exchanges

properties.name: Select Method (EX: GET, PUT, POST, DELETE)
properties.description: The primary or most commonly-used HTTP methods are POST, GET, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE. These methods correspond to create, read, update, and delete (or CRUD) operations, respectively. There are a number of other methods, too, but they are utilized less frequently.

properties.name: Header User-Agent (optional)
properties.description: The User-Agent request header is a characteristic string that lets servers and network peers identify the application, operating system, vendor, and/or version of the requesting user agent

properties.name: Error Message
properties.description: Created Object Error Message

properties.name: Header Accept (Optional)
properties.description: The Accept request HTTP header indicates which content types, expressed as MIME types, the client is able to understand. The server uses content negotiation to select one of the proposals and informs the client of the choice with the Content-Type response header.

properties.name: Value (Only For Tenant creation) Provide Tenant id
Headers Cookie (Not Mandatory)
properties.description:
An HTTP cookie (web cookie, browser cookie) is a small piece of data that a server sends to a user's web browser. The browser may store the cookie and send it back to the same server with later requests. Typically, an HTTP cookie is used to tell if two requests come from the same browser—keeping a user logged in, for example. It remembers stateful information for the stateless HTTP protocol.

Cookies are mainly used for three purposes:

Session management
Logins, shopping carts, game scores, or anything else the server should remember

Personalization
User preferences, themes, and other settings

Tracking
Recording and analyzing user behavior

properties.script:
import random
import string

def get_random_string(length):
    # choose from all lowercase letter
    letters = string.ascii_lowercase
    result_str = ''.join(random.choice(letters) for i in range(length))
    print(result_str)

get_random_string(8)
